intro: Rudgea myrsinifolia, commonly known as the pink-flowered rudgea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. Its showy, pink or red flowers are clustered in umbels, adding ornamental value to the plant. Rudgea myrsinifolia is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and vibrant floral displays.
